intro: Dendrophthora gracilipes, commonly known as the slender-stemmed mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of various host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and white, sticky berries. The plant derives some of its nutrients from its host through specialized root structures called haustoria. It is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, often in humid forest environments. Its presence can affect the health of its host tree, making it an important ecological factor in its habitat.
